section.title: should , shouldn't
section.sectiontitle: We use subject + should + verb to say that something is a good idea or the right thing to do. We use subject + shouldn't + verb to say that something is not a good idea or not the right thing to do.
section.text1: It's a good idea to buy a dictionary.
section.text2: It's not right to tell Mark.
section.sectiontitle2: In the question, we use should + subject + verb.
section.text3a: Should I take an aspirin? Yes, you should.
section.text4a: Should they pay now? No, they shouldn't.

section.title: Other phrases for giving advice
section.sectiontitle: We also use Why don't you + verb and Try + verb + -ing to give advice.
section.text1: It's a good idea to see a doctor.
section.text2: It's a good idea to get up earlier.
